items.description: River Maun in Nottinghamshire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. 
We continue to monitor the situation. Our incident response staff are liaising with emergency services and patrolling watercourses in the area. Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid contact with flood water.

Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.
We recommend that you avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses as there may still be standing water in some locations.
We will continue to monitor the river level and observe weather forecasts, and we will issue a new flood message if needed. We recommend that you remain aware of the forecast for the next 5 days.

items.description: River Maun at Sherwood Forest Caravan Park near Kings Clipstone
items.message:
This Flood Warning has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold for the Flood Warning. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding may still affect roads and low-lying land.  No further significant rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. 
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

items.description: Severn Estuary at Severn Beach
items.message: The tides are now receding following spring tides at the weekend and the period of high winds has passed. This means there is no longer a risk of flooding. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.description: Dragley Beck at Ulverston from Dragley Beck Bridge on Well Lane downstream to South Ulverston
items.message:
Flooding is expected in this area. This means properties are at risk of flooding.

Please take action to protect yourself and your property and monitor local weather and river conditions. Avoid contact with, walking or driving through flood water. Consider activating any property flood protection products you may have.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.
